metadata.name: DAO is a Political Game 1
metadata.description:
*50% of all income of this NFT will be send to The Noun Square's Treasury*

Yesterday at [@thenounsquare](https://twitter.com/thenounsquare) we had a fasinating [Twitter space](https://twitter.com/thenounsquare/status/1616364277337849857) about social capital and community governance. Right after the space, I got DMs from some builders in Nouns community talked about their frustrating experiences in the community. Then I think I should write something down for builders who want to join any DAO.

The idea of DAO itself is very attractive, builders love the idea. It is thought of as a collaborative utopia where builders can get funding to support their ideas and work with each other around a common goal, just building and nothing else. As a result, many idealistic builders have joined various DAOs. Sadly the truth is idealistic people are always more likely to be hurt.

For savvy leechers, entering a DAO is like wolf in sheep, stealing credits from builders and capturing the treasury's resources. A politically immature DAO with a huge treasury is like a child carrying gold in a downtown and is lucky not to be robbed.

> If you don't understand the political mechanics of Nouns funding filtering process, you are gonna be very frustrated. Because you are not politically savvy enough to actually make that filtering process work for you. - [@JesseRising](https://twitter.com/JesseRising)

If a DAO wants to work and not let leechers expel builders. Builders should know more about playing politics and getting social capital better than leechers. 

But most builders are actually introverts, preferring to get down to build rather than compete for credit. As Nouns community, I think we should help these kinds of builders to gain more social capital. At the very least, builders should understand the nature of community governance.

> Let's build that social capital, that is the name of this game, social capital. - [@JesseRising](https://twitter.com/JesseRising)

In a [discussion](https://discord.com/channels/954142017556979752/966075869674213416/1065016195943759973) on the Lil Nouns Discord channel, [@zamees](https://twitter.com/zamees) likened the current DAO to the Wild West.

> I love the Wild West without all the guns! - [@zamees](https://twitter.com/zamees)

The harsh reality is that if you want to have fun in the Wild West, firstly you have to be good at marksmanship, or at least be able to protect yourself.

It seems that we need to write a **"Wild West Survival Guide"** for all builders. I love Nouns, so let's protect it with our own guns.
